options.name: Archive

options.description: Leaves a conversation

options.name: Member
options.description: List members of a conversation

properties.description: Channel containing the message. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

properties.description: Timestamp of the message to get permanent link

properties.name: channel
properties.description: The channel to send the message to

properties.description: Other options to set

options.name: icon_emoji
options.description: Emoji to use as the icon for this message. Overrides icon_url.

options.name: icon_url
options.description: URL to an image to use as the icon for this message

options.name: link_names
options.description: Whether to find and link channel names and usernames

options.name: thread_ts
options.description: Provide another message's ts value to make this message a reply

options.name: mrkdwn
options.description: Whether to use Slack Markdown parsing

options.name: reply_broadcast
options.description: Whether the reply should be made visible to everyone in the channel or conversation. Use in conjunction with thread_ts.

options.name: unfurl_links
options.description: Whether to enable unfurling of primarily text-based content

options.name: unfurl_media
options.description: Whether to disable unfurling of media content

options.name: sendAsUser
options.description: The message will be sent from this username (i.e. as if this individual sent the message).

values.name: blockId
values.description: A string acting as a unique identifier for a block. You can use this block_id when you receive an interaction payload to identify the source of the action. If not specified, a block_id will be generated. Maximum length for this field is 255 characters.

values.name: type
values.description: The type of element

values.name: text
values.description: The text for the block

values.name: emoji
values.description: Whether emojis in a text field should be escaped into the colon emoji format

values.name: actionId
values.description: An identifier for this action. You can use this when you receive an interaction payload to identify the source of the action. Should be unique among all other action_ids used elsewhere by your app.

values.name: url
values.description: A URL to load in the user's browser when the button is clicked. Maximum length for this field is 3000 characters. If you're using URL, you'll still receive an interaction payload and will need to send an acknowledgement response.

values.name: value
values.description: The value to send along with the interaction payload

values.name: style
values.description: Decorates buttons with alternative visual color schemes

values.name: textUi
type
values.description: The formatting to use for this text object

values.name: text
values.description: The text for the block. This field accepts any of the standard text formatting markup when type is mrkdwn.

values.name: emoji
values.description: Whether emojis in a text field should be escaped into the colon emoji format. This field is only usable when type is plain_text.

values.name: verbatim
values.description: Whether to set to false (as is default) URLs will be auto-converted into links, conversation names will be link-ified, and certain mentions will be automatically parsed

values.description: When set to false (as is default) URLs will be auto-converted into links, conversation names will be link-ified, and certain mentions will be automatically parsed

values.description: ID of the field to set. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

values.name: value
values.description: Value of the field to set

options.name: email
options.description: This field can only be changed by admins for users on paid teams

options.name: status_emoji
options.description: Is a string referencing an emoji enabled for the Slack team, such as :mountain_railway:

options.name: status_expiration
options.description: Is an integer specifying seconds since the epoch, more commonly known as "UNIX time". Providing 0 or omitting this field results in a custom status that will not expire.

options.name: status_text
options.description: Allows up to 100 characters, though we strongly encourage brevity

options.name: user
options.description: ID of user to change. This argument may only be specified by team admins on paid teams.

options.name: include_labels
options.description: Whether to include labels for each ID in custom profile fields

options.name: user
options.description: User to retrieve profile info for

options.name: Run Once for All Items
options.description: Run this code only once, no matter how many input items there are

options.name: Run Once for Each Item
options.description: Run this code as many times as there are input items

properties.name: jsCode
properties.description:
JavaScript code to execute.

Tip: You can use luxon vars like $today for dates and $jmespath for querying JSON structures. Learn more.

properties.displayName: Type $ for a list of special vars/methods. Debug by using console.log() statements and viewing their output in the browser console.

options.description: Whether to list only upcoming events

values.name: field1
values.hint: Enter the field name as text

values.name: field2
values.hint: Enter the field name as text

options.name: Use a Mix of Versions
options.description: Output uses different inputs for different fields

options.name: Include Both Versions
options.description: Output contains all data (but structure more complex)

properties.name: exceptWhenMix
properties.hint: Enter the names of the input fields as text, separated by commas

options.name: disableDotNotation
options.description: Whether to disallow referencing child fields using `parent.child` in the field name

options.name: Include First Match Only
options.description: Only ever output a single item per match

options.name: Include All Matches
options.description: Output multiple items if there are multiple matches

properties.name: binaryPropertyName
properties.description: Name of the binary property which contains the data for the file(s) to be compress/decompress. Multiple can be used separated by a comma (,).

properties.name: outputFormat
properties.description: Format of the output file

properties.name: fileName
properties.description: Name of the file to be compressed

properties.name: binaryPropertyOutput
properties.description: Name of the binary property to which to write the data of the compressed files

properties.name: outputPrefix
properties.description: Prefix use for all gzip compresed files

properties.name: outputPrefix
properties.description: Prefix use for all decompressed files

properties.name: source
properties.description: Pick where your data comes from, delivery or preview API

properties.name: environmentId
properties.description: The ID for the Contentful environment (e.g. master, staging, etc.). Depending on your plan, you might not have environments. In that case use "master".

options.name: rawData
options.description: Whether the data should be returned RAW instead of parsed

properties.name: environmentId
properties.description: The ID for the Contentful environment (e.g. master, staging, etc.). Depending on your plan, you might not have environments. In that case use "master".

properties.name: returnAll
properties.description: Whether to return all results or only up to a given limit

properties.name: limit
properties.description: Max number of results to return

options.name: content_type
options.description: To search for entries with a specific content type

options.name: equal
options.description: Search for all data that matches the condition: {attribute}={value}. Attribute can use dot notation.

options.name: exclude
options.description: Search for all data that matches the condition: {attribute}[nin]={value}. Attribute can use dot notation.

options.name: exist
options.description: Search for all data that matches the condition: {attribute}[exists]={value}. Attribute can use dot notation.

options.name: select
options.description: The select operator allows you to choose what fields to return from an entity. You can choose multiple values by combining comma-separated operators.

options.name: include
options.description: Search for all data that matches the condition: {attribute}[in]={value}. Attribute can use dot notation.

options.name: notEqual
options.description: Search for all data that matches the condition: {attribute}[ne]={value}. Attribute can use dot notation.

options.name: order
options.description: You can order items in the response by specifying the order search parameter. You can use sys properties (such as sys.createdAt) or field values (such as fields.myCustomDateField) for ordering.

options.name: query
options.description: Full-text search is case insensitive and might return more results than expected. A query will only take values with more than 1 character.

options.name: rawData
options.description: Whether the data should be returned RAW instead of parsed
